newsitem.title: REPUBLIC OF IRELAND: CBT reports 130 pct growth in income.
newsitem.headline: CBT reports 130 pct growth in income.

text.p: Dublin-based software company CBT on Tuesday reported 130 percent growth in net income to $13.1 million in calendar 1996 from $5.7 million in 1995.
Revenues grew from $40.2 million in 1995 to $66.3 million, an increase of 65 percent. Net income per ADR was $0.67, compared with $0.33.
CBT has continued to experience solid growth through signing new contracts, deepening penetration of the existing customer base, executive chairman Bill McCabe said in a statement.

It said it planned to build on its growing base in the Internet market after developing agreements with leading software providers and to target the medium-sized business market as well as the education and government sectors.
